title: Youth unemployment rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
The maximum Unemployment rate 53.6 is found at Month Sicily and the minimum is found at Trentino-South Tyrol where Month is 11.9.
Month Sicily has 4.5 times more Unemployment rate than Month Trentino-South Tyrol which is has the lowest.
min_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
Month Sicily has the highest Unemployment rate and Trentino-South Tyrol has the lowest Unemployment rate.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
The maximum Unemployment rate 53.6 is found at Month Sicily and the minimum is found at Trentino-South Tyrol where Month is 11.9.
Month Sicily has 4.5 times more Unemployment rate than Month Trentino-South Tyrol which is has the lowest.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
Month Sicily has the highest Unemployment rate and Trentino-South Tyrol has the lowest Unemployment rate.
There is a difference of 41.7 between the maximum Month Sicily and minimum Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
The Month Sicily has the highest Unemployment rate, followed by Campania, and Calabria. Down to the Month Trentino-South Tyrol which is the lowest.
Over the past 20 Months, the Unemployment rate has decreased.
Month Sicily, and Campania have a similar Unemployment rate that is 53.6.
The highest value 53.6 at Sicily is almost 1.67 times larger than the average value 32.08.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 641.7.
